assetDescriptions.description:
Run 4 Those Who Can't 5K Run and Family Walk is an opportunity to bring hope to people living with ALS, to raise money for a cure, and to come together for someone you care about. The Run 4 Those Who Can't will be an annual event, which raises funds that allow our local chapters of Las Vegas to sustain care services, support people with ALS and their families. We thank you for your support! 

Event details and schedule

WE will start at 8am for the all participants with timing and 8:10 for all non timing participants. 

 

Packet Pick-up: December 2, 2016

@ Anthem Fitness on 10909 S. Eastern Ave. Henderson, NV. 89052

From: 11 am to 6 pm you will be able to pick up your packet before the race as well so please make time for before the race to do so. 

There is going to be an other event at the Soccer Complex that day so please get ther early for parking.

assetDescriptions.description:
Our challenging course winds through the Mojave Desert in its natural state.  The out-and-back Half-Marathon course is hilly with significant uphill and downhill throughout.  Both the Half-Marathon and the 5K will be run on the same smooth asphalt trail.

 

Event details and schedule

Saturday, December 17, 2016, 8:00 a.m.

 

Mountain Lake Park, Henderson, NV

The Half-Marathon Course: Out and Back on smooth asphalt trail.  Start/Finish at Mountain Lake Park and run to the River Mountains Loop Trail.  Turn south and run the trail to the turnaround point.

The Elevations: 2087’ Start/Finish       1718’ Low Point       2314’ High Point

The 5K Course: The same smooth asphalt trail as the Half-Marathon...out-and-back.

The Aid Stations: 2m/11m, 4m/9m, 6m/7m

The Post Race Food & Beverage: Water, Gatorade, Fruit, Bagels, Cookies

Packet Pick-up: Friday, December 16, 10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m., Red Rock Running Company in the District at Green Valley Ranch, 144 S. Green Valley Pkwy., #144, Henderson, nV  89012 (702.998.9054 for directions)

assetComponents.assetName: Sponsor A Child ($30 per child) - Sponsor A Child

assetDescriptions.description:
Be there with bells on – jingle bells, that is! Ring in the holiday season with a Christmas fun run for the entire family. Don your best holiday apparel and jingle all the way down a 3.1-mile course along Pittman Wash Trail.  Afterwards, enjoy your favorite holiday music from a live DJ and visit with good old St. Nick. There will also be hot chocolate, coffee and cookies for purchase courtesy of Makena Lei's Shave Ice & Goodies. All fitness levels are welcome. Ages 5 and up. 

 

Event details and schedule

Early Registration

$25 (June 18-November 12)

$35 (November 13-December 15)

*If you currently have a City of Henderson online registration account and prefer to register via our website, please visit us at cityofhenderson.com. If you do not have an online registration account, please visit one of our recreation centers to sign up. Please call 702-267-4050 if you need any further assistance.

Packet Pick Up

Silver Springs Recreation Center | 1951 Silver Springs Pkwy.
December 15 | 3pm-7pm

Come end your year with a New Year's Eve race in Las Vegas!  Just 20 minutes from the strip and plenty of time after the race for all your festivities!  We have a 10k, 5k ans 1 mile option.  Bring your friends and family and celebrate with us at our Resoution Run, 6 years standing

Event details and schedule

Come celebrate your New Year with us and run our race! We've got a 10k, 5k and 1miler for you to chose from! Bring your friends and family and have some New Year fun.  No better way to start off your New Years resolutions!

Event details and schedule

We all know someone who has been a victim of bullying - in school, at home, online or even in the workplace. Join two great local charities for our innagural Be Brave 5K run & walk and make a pledge to end bullying in our community! Your registration as a runner/walker will ensure you'll become an influential part of this fun collaborative event to support the anti-bullying campaigns and programs of the Never Give Up Foundation, Nevada Child Seekers and its incredible community partners in Las Vegas. Remember - We won't stop until bullying does!

Event details and schedule

REGISTRATION: Runners/walkers may pickup their event packets and sign waivers at the registration tables beginning at 7:30AM

WALK: 5K walk kicks-off at 8:30AM

RUN: 5K run kicks-off at 8:45AM

MERCH: Additional Be Brave/Never Give Up t-shirts and merchandise will be available.

Please encourage your friends and family to run or walk with you and also cheer you on!

VOLUNTEERS: Still needed to ensure our event is a BIG success! Please reach out to Kyle to inquire about exciting volunteer positions, ranging from promotions leading up to the event, to runner support and medical during day of: kcdunlap@gmail.com

PARKING: Free and available close to the entrance to Floyd Lamb State Park. After you park, simply follow Be Brave 5K signs to the registration table. 

WHAT TO BRING: ID, copy of registration confirmation/Active.com QR code for quick sign-in, cash/credit card for merchandise purchases/donations/late registration fees, preferred refreshments (electrolyte packets, gels, water bottle), headphones, WARM running/walking gear and your friends and family!

PROVIDED: water/refuel stations at each kilometer mark, full-support team including medical, DJ with fun music to get you pumped to Be Brave, finish token and a big high five to remind you that you've inspired others to Never Give Up!

Moo've it with your friends and family at the Chick-fil-A Connect Race Series of Henderson, NV on January 21, 2017. Proceeds from the race will benefit the mission of Folds of Honor - a non-profit organization dedicated to providing scholarships and assistance to spouses and children of those killed or disabled in service to America. All proceeds from this event will benefit a local student through Folds of Honor. Race Participants will have the exclusive opportunity to enjoy Chick-fil-A Chicken Sandwiches in advance of the restaurants opening next year.

The 5K race includes:

  • ChronoTrack Chip Timing
  • USATF Certified Course
  • Dri-fit Shirt
  • Overall & Age Group Awards
  • Chance to win Chick-fil-A Prizes!

A FREE Family FunZone for children under 12 years of age will be located near the finish line of the race. The Family FunZone will be open from 8:00-10:00 AM on event day and will be filled with fun, free activities and inflatables!

 

Event details and schedule

The Ultimate Wine Run is a highly anticipated & adventurous event held at  vineyards and venues throughout the country. Our Race Day Run & Party includes an amazing 5k run  through a vineyard or venue with lots of wine & fun festivities for you & your entire family. The evening will be packed with surprises. Not to let the cat out of the bag, but some of the activities that will be on the itinerary are: a rocking live DJ, a dance floor, amazing food trucks. Oh yes, and lots of  wine – wine – wine – and more wine.  Have we tickled your fancy yet? I hope so because this is going to be the funnest 5k run ever & the livest party of the year! Bring all of your friends & family, lawn chairs & blankets & take a moment to experience an epic evening you’ll never forget.

Event details and schedule

EVERY REGISTERED 5k RUNNER Receives:

  • Ultimate Wine Run T-Shirt (Unisex)
  • Customized Medal
  • Ultimate Wine Run Souvenir Glass with 5oz pour of Wine received at the 5k finish line

assetDescriptions.description:
What is The Happy Hour Run?  The Happy Hour Run is a highly anticipated & adventurous event held at venues throughout the country. The Happy Hour  Run is the only run of its kind with an evening race followed by a live party full of intriguing festivities that include a DJ, Food trucks , Beer Pong, Cornhole , Giant Jenga and of course a bar!

 Just think, all of this after a 5k run. Its party time. So bring your blankets and lawn chairs, bring all of your family & friends & get ready for a festival like no other. You must be 21 years or older to run, but kids are welcomed to join the rest of the fun.

 We will cheer with you as you cross the finish line.  Oh!!! Yes, we will have an award winning medal waiting for you at the finish line. And then it’s on to the post-race party.  You will be able to boogie the night away with our live DJ, food, games and bar. 

 

Did you think that was it?  Come on, you know we are going to continue to amaze you!  There will be prizes for the top three finishers for males and females.

 

Also wear your wackiest costumes, funny hats, creative make-up and be prepared to have the time of your life,  There are prizes for the best costume and largest group.

 

Bring folding chairs and blankets out to relax and enjoy the event with friends and family.

 

Event details and schedule

Each registered participant and finisher will receive the following: 

• The Biggest Loser Finisher's Medal (All Events)
• Commemorative T-Shirt (All Events)
• Drawstring Backpack (All Events)
• Chip-Timed Race for Runners and Those Tracking Personal Goals (5k/Half Marathon Events)
• Free Downloadable Race Photos (All Events)
• Award Divisions for Runners and Walkers (5k and Half Marathon Events)

• Celebrity Appearances (All Events)
• Hydration Stations with Water/Sports Drinks Along the Course
  and Food at the Finish Line (5k and Half Marathon Events)
• Finish Line Festival Entertainment 
• Last but not Least, a Truly Inspirational and Unforgettable Experience

The top male and female racer in each of the competitive heats will win awards and prizes.

Event details and schedule

assetDescriptions.description:
The Super Run 5k is a superhero themed run where you become a real life superhero!  Grab your cape and fly over to The Super Run for a 5k fun run, music, festivities and more.  

 

Every participant gets an authentic event superhero cape and collectable run bib.  The finishers get a super finishers medal!

 

Run for fun, or choose your favorite charity to raise money for.   

 

Be a Hero.  Help a Cause.  Join the Run.  TheSuperRun.com

Event details and schedule

For info on the event please visit www.TheSuperRun.com.

  • Friday before the run: Packet Pick up 4pm - 8pm.  

  • Day of event:

    • 8am Registration/ Packet Pick up Opens

    • 8am Music and Festivities Start

    • 9am The Super Run 5k Starts

    • 11am The event closes down until next time!

results.assetName: The Super Run 5K- Las Vegas, NV 2017

assetDescriptions.description:
The Brady Heart Foundation 5k and 1 mile run will be held in the perfect cool mornings of February in the spectacular city of Las Vegas, NV. 5k and 1 mile participants will start in Sunset Park and will run a designated loop inside the park. Sunset Park is a beautiful spot that is quiet and peaceful in the bustling city or Las Vegas. In the last few years the city of Las Vegas added a fantastic trail system within Sunset Park and it is very excting that we have the privilege to make great use of the trails.

Runners will start and finish in the same spot so there is no need to worry about transportation from the starting line to the finish line.  The course will be marked to limit the amount of runners that may get lost along the way.  The trail system is located on the south end of the park and we will have our banners out to help participants find where we are located.  

There will be a 75 minute time limit for the 5k. That gives plenty of time for walkers. No one will be removed from the corse that means if it takes you longer that's ok. We will be holding awards for the first place male and female finisher 60 minuntes after start time. There will be no prize for any first place finishers of the 1 mile fun walk.  Only the first male and female finisher for the 5k will be receiving a finisher prize. 

 Come enjoy the scenery, beautiful path, and most importantly do it for a great cause. 

Event details and schedule

SAME DAY REGISTRATION

There will be same day registration. We recommend that you come 90 minutes before start time to ensure that you will be registered into the system and will be issued a bib number.  If you register after January 25,2017 we cannot gaurantee that you will recieve a t-shirt.  That means if you register on the event day we cannot gaurantee that you will receive an awesome cool t-shirt. But you will still have a great time running with the awesome people that do! No worries though we still think you're super awesome for choosing to spend your Saturday morning with us! 

COURSE 

Runners for the 5k and 1M will start in Sunset park and run along the marked path per their particular race event. 5k runners will head west on the path and 1M runners will run east along the.  We have been given permission to run in the park and on the path however this is a public park and the course will not be closed to the public. It is important that runners be kind and courteous to visitors to the park and those running/walking on the pathways.

There will be 1 water station for those that are participating in the 5k run. It will be placed near mile 1.5.  There will also be water available at the finish line.  It is important that you hydrate before, during and after the race. If you are in need of water while you run you should consider carrying a water bottle or having some device to carry your water like a running belt.  The Brady Heart Foundation is not resposible to provide water beyond the water station and finish line so please be sure to hydrate properly as.

There will be no water stations provided during the 1M course. So please plan accordingly.

STROLLERS

Strollers are welcome on both courses. We ask that those that are running the 5k with a stroller line up toward the back of the pack.

PARKING

Parking will be on a first come fiirst served basis.  There will be no specified or marked parking areas. Sunset Park is a public park we are required to obey all traffic laws. Parking will be best on the south end of the park just south of the lake. There are 2 parking lots that are located there. There is also parking located near the baseball fields. 

ATTIRE

You can wear whatever you feel is comfortable. We recommend that you wear comfortable and cool active wear designed for running.  Please dress according to the winter weather. Please know that running naked is strictly prohibited. Not only is it not pretty to look at but its inconsioderate and against the law.  If you are found running naked you will be removed from the course.  So please DON'T DO IT!!

DON'T FORGET YOUR SHOES! It happens people. We reccomend that you wear regular running shoes trail shoes are not required. But do what you want it's your feet! If you are a barefoot runner completely disregard this paragraph altogether. But know that the rest of us wonder in awe when you run on rocks. 

IPODS

iPods and other devices with earbuds are permitted on the course however we recommend that you keep one ear bud out of one ear for safety purposes.

EVENT SCHEDULE

Bib pick up/check in will be on 2/10/16 place and time TBA

 If you cannot be present for packet pickup on 2/10/16 you can send another person to check in for you provided they have a copy or your current ID or email confirmation or you can check in on race day.

You can check in 1 hour before start time but we recommend that you pick up your packet and check in the night before. This will help with the ease of the event for our volunteers and for you. This will also ensure our runners have a smoother and more pleasant experience. But we understand that sometimes that just doesn't work out for everyone. Don't be discouraged come when you can but don't be late on race day! If you register on the day of the race you MUST check in no later than 8:45 am to secure a spot to run in either event.

Check in 7:00 am

Check in closes 8:45 am

5k start 9:00 am 

1 mile start 9:10 am

Awards 10:00 am for first male and female to cross the finish line for the 5k

TIMING

The 5k race will be timed but it will not be bib or chipped timed.  The only racers that will get an official time will be the first male and first female runner to cross the finish line. We will do our best to write down and keep times of all runners crossing the finish line. We will not have the race  professionally timed this saves us a big expense and that means there are more funds that can go to the women and their families that are in need. It also means we can hold more and better events.  We apprieciate your understanding that not everyone will have an official time or place.  If you would like to be timed you are welcome to use your own stop watch, gps device, gps watch or other electronic device.  We will give runners 75 minutes to complete the race before we shut the clock down. That is plenty of time to walk. And walkers are welcome!

The 1M race will not be timed. Awards for the 5k will be given at 10:00 am. Raffel drawings will follow after at 10:15. The clock will be shutdown 75 min after the the start of the 5k.  

 SPECIAL NOTICE

The Brady Heart Foundation partners with a group called Red Thumbs For Women.  During the month of February, which is heart health awareness month, Red Thumbs For Women spreads the word about heart disease by encouraging men and women to paint one thumb nail red. Since we are partners in trying to create awareness and education about heart disease any runner that checks in with a red thumb will get a special free prize. Don't forget to post a picture on social media with #redthumbsforwomen and #brady5kvegas

Also known as The Happiest 5k on the Planet, we love chucking paint and making people smile. With events in more than 50 countries, The Color Run is on almost every single continent on EARTH!

Less about your 10-minute-mile and more about having the time of your life, The Color Run is a five-kilometer, un-timed race in which thousands of participants are doused from head to toe in different colors at each kilometer.

With only two rules, the idea is easy to follow:

1. Wear white at the starting line
2. Finish plastered in color!

The fun continues after Color Runners complete the race with an unforgettable Finish Festival. This larger than life party is equipped with music, dancing and massive color throws, which create millions of vivid color combinations. Trust us, this is the best post-5k party on the planet!

It's a unique paint race that celebrates healthiness, happiness and individuality. We're making rainbows all over the world, come join us!

Event details and schedule

The start-line window will open at 8:00 AM with waves going every few minutes until about 8:45 AM! Make sure you plan your day with plenty of time. At The Color Run, the start line is its own pre-race party with music, dancing, warmup stretching and giveaways!

assetComponents.assetName: 8:00 AM - PAID LITTLE COLOR RUNNER with PARTICIPANT KIT - Entry & Youth Participant Kit
8:00 AM - FREE LITTLE COLOR RUNNER without PARTICIPANT KIT - Entry Only.  Will not receive participant kit.

assetDescriptions.description:
The Vegas Cares About Rare 5K Run / 1M Walk is scheduled for Saturday, February 25th in Las Vegas (Kellogg Zaher Sports Complex). Proceeds from this event will benefit the Little Miss Hannah Foundation, a Las Vegas 501(c)(3) non-profit charity. The organization's mission is to assist families caring for children that are diagnosed with a rare diseases, life-limiting or complex medical conditions, and those children placed in palliative or hospice care.

(Download flyer / sponsorship info / volunteer info / FAQs / main page)

This event is scheduled to commemorate the celebration of World Rare Disease Day, which takes place on the last day in February each year. Did you know:

  • There are over 7,000 rare diseases in the world
  • Rare disease affects 1 in 10 Americans
  • More than 50% of rare diseases affect children
  • 30% of children diagnosed with rare and genetic disorders don't live to see their 3rd birthday 

During this complicated time, families struggle to obtain expensive medical and therapy equipment designed to provide safety to these children and to improve the quality of their lives. The Little Miss Hannah Foundation provides this equipment at no cost to the families to enhance the quality of life of their children. Meet some of our special kids!

** Join early and save! Create a team with your colleagues at work or school and save $5 per runner! **

5K individual (Timed)

$35 - 10/1 thru 11/30
$40 - 12/1 thru 1/31
$45 - 2/1 thru 2/23

5K team (Timed)
$30 - 10/1 thru 11/30
$35 - 12/1 thru 1/31
$40 - 2/1 thru 2/23

1M individual (Not timed)
$30 - 10/1 thru 2/23

Virtual 5K
$35 - Includes custom bib, medal and t-shirt!

 

Event details and schedule

Schedule:

7:00 Registration and check-in
7:30 Welcome
8:15 5K Start
8:30 1M Start
9:30 Awards Ceremony

Coming Soon!

assetDescriptions.description:
Come TRASH those trail legs at this exciting and challenging race series! The race starts at the beautiful Hidden Falls Park and continues onto the Amargosa and Sloan Canyon trail systems. This trail system begins at around 2400 feet elevation, and parts of the 50-miler and 100- miler hit at around 3200 feet in elevation. Many of the trails in this race will be raced on for the first time with us! The terrain is varied, with wide groomed trails and challenging single-track. The views are spectacular: mountains, valleys, and the Las Vegas Strip! We have an "early start" option for the 50-miler and 100-miler at 5 AM. Regular start times are as follows: 100-miler - 5:30 AM, 50-miler - 6 AM, Marathon - 6:30 AM, 1/2 Marathon - 7 AM, 10K - 7:30 AM, 5K - 8 AM, Kids' 1 Mile Race - 10 AM.
Race directors run for FREE and Military/Veterans are ALWAYS steeply discounted. 
Thank you for your service!

Event details and schedule

SUPPORT  YOUR  COMMUNITY &  LOCAL   MILITARY   @   THE   4TH   ANNUAL   STRIP   O N   THE   STRIP™   5K

 
Strip on the Strip™ is a 5K/1M walk/run down Las Vegas Blvd. where participants donate a piece of clothing at each 1K benefiting Goodwill Southern Nevada in support of their Veterans Integration Program. Participants receive race t-shirt, finisher medal, swag bag, and a ticket to the official Strip on the Strip After Party. Whether you are a competitive runner, a 5K virgin, looking for corporate team building activity or just want to have fun with family and friends, Strip on the Strip™ 5K is for everyone.

Event details and schedule

EVENT SCHEDULE AND TIMES
7:45AM  REGISTRATION  OPENS
8:45AM  EVENT KICKOFF   (NATIONAL ANTHEM/GROUP STRETCH  )
9:00AM  RACE BEGINS 
     WAVE 1 - CAPTAINS AND ANGELS START
     WAVE 2 - MILITARY START
     WAVE 3 - COMPETITIVE RUNNERS  START
      WAVE 4 - RUNNERS START 
     WAVE 5 - WALKERS/JOGGERS START
9:30AM  POST  RACE  FESTIVITIES  COMMENCE
9:45AM  AWARD  CEREMONY
NOTE: TIMES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE

assetDescriptions.description:
Join us on Saturday, March 11, 2017 for the 16th annual Run Away With Cirque du Soleil at the Springs Preserve.  

Online Registration will begin in January 2017.

 

Run or walk with your favorite Cirque du Soleil artists at this annual event that includes music from cast and crew, photo opportunities with performers and a circus play area for children.  This event is presented by Cirque du Soleil in partnership with the Springs Preserve.  All proceeds support the Springs Preserve and Cirque du Soleil Foundations.

Event details and schedule

Event Features:

  • 5K Competitive Individual and Team Timing. A minimum of 10 participants are required to qualify for Team categories.
  • All participants will also be included in a raffle for prizes including a chance to win show tickets to the Las Vegas Cirque du Soleil shows. Also included are prizes from the Springs Preserve.
  • Music by the cast and crew of Cirque du Soleil.
  • Photo opportunities by Cashman Photo with performers from Cirque du Soleil.
  • Complimentary massage therapy
  • Complimentary refreshments for participants provided by Whole Foods Market.
  • Face painting and circus fun play area.
  • Access to the Springs Preserve museums and galleries with race bib.

EVENT INFORMATION

This is an all ages event, children under the age of three do not need to register.

All entries are non-refundable, non-transferable and non-tax deductible.

 

 

AWARDS FOR COMPETITIVE (Chip Timed) 5K Awards will be given to the following 5K Run (only) participants

 • Overall male & female finishes

• Overall Cirque du Soleil employee male and female finishes

• Three (3) deep in ALL age divisions

• Overall male, female and mixed Teams (mixed teams must contain at least three females)

 

Race Day Schedule

7:00 a.m. Registration opens

7:30 a.m. Pre-race activities and warm-up begin

8:00 a.m. Registration closes

8:30 a.m. Race Start

9:00 a.m. Music followed by Awards Ceremony

 

Don’t forget!

Bring water and sun block! The Springs Preserve is a smoke and pet

free environment.

PARKING is available in the Springs Preserve lots and in the Las Vegas Valley Water District Remote lot located at the northwest corner of Valley View and Alta.  *Please do not park in private business lots who have “Tow Warning” signs posted.

results.assetName: Run Away With Cirque du Soleil at the Springs Preserve 5K Run & 1-Mile Fun Walk 2017

assetDescriptions.description:
Limited time offer: Use code 5KCOLORBLAST for $30 off registration (any category)!

5KColorBlast color runs will exceed your expectations for fun!

www.5KColorBlast.com

100% of proceeds benefit scientific research on cancer and Alzheimer's disease.  Your participation in 5KColorBlast makes a difference!

5KColorBlast is the best color-themed race that celebrates fitness, friends, and fun.  It’s a color party with a purpose!

Start in white and get ready for the 5KColorBlast!

All participants receive a free 5KColorBlast t-shirt, race bib, finisher medal, temp tattoo, color pack, refreshments, and entrance to the post-race 5KColorBlast Party (a celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!)

Four Reasons to Choose 5KColorBlast:

  • FUN:  Twice the color, lowest prices, free t-shirt and finisher medal, music/dancing/color celebration!
  • LOCATION:  Nationwide in 2017!
  • CHARITY:  100% of proceeds donated to AD research.
  • COLOR:  A celebration of color!

 

What is the color made from?
The magical color powder we use is custom manufactured and produced in the United States.  It is made from food grade quality cornstarch and is 100% non-toxic and biodegradable.  As with any substance, you will want to keep it out of your eyes and lungs.  If you are overly sensitive, you may want to wear glasses or goggles for your eyes and use a bandana or dust mask for your mouth (this is especially recommended for our younger runners/walkers).

Is the race timed?
No, the race and its participants do not get timed.  Run, skip, or walk!  5KColorBlast is about having a good time for a great cause.

Will the color stain my clothes, shoes, or makeup?
If you want a lot of color to hit your free t-shirt, plan to run or walk closer to the color throwers.  If you want only a little bit of color, run or walk in the farthest lane from the throwers.  The color does wash out after the event.  As with any stain, the sooner you wash it the better.  We suggest wearing items that you wouldn't mind getting the color on.

Will the color get in my car?
Bring a towel or some plastic bags along, and you’ll be just fine.  However, if you do get some in your vehicle, it can be dusted away or vacuumed easily.

Event details and schedule

  • 8:00am:  Runners arrive on site.  On-site check-in begins.
  • 9:30am:  On-site check-in ends.  Runners, please be on-site and checked in by this time (30 minutes prior to the start of the race).
  • 9:50am:  Runners start to line up.
  • 10:00am:  The 5KColorBlast race begins!
  • 11:00am:  5KColorBlast Party!  A celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!

assetComponents.assetName: Individual - Run/Walk/Skip/Dance: Includes race packet: T-shirt, finisher medal, race bib, temp tattoo, color pack, and entrance to the post-race 5KColorBlast Party (a celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!)

Teams - Run/Walk/Skip/Dance: Includes race packet: T-shirt, finisher medal, race bib, temp tattoo, color pack, and entrance to the post-race 5KColorBlast Party (a celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!)

assetDescriptions.description:
Margarita Madness 5k™ is a unique night 5K fun run focused less on speed and more onMargarita fun with friends and family. Margarita  participants come from all different ages, shapes, sizes, and speeds; every participant will get Mad Margaritas ™ and have the time of their life. Whether you are an avid runner or a walk around the park walker, the 3 miles of the Margarita Madness  5k™ course will have you beaming and waiting for the next one!

Event details and schedule

San Antonio

MARGARITA RUNNERS

  • $20 Pre-Sale
  • $20 PRICE ENDS SOON  THEN IT GOES UP TO $40
  • Margarita Madness T-Shirt
  •  Margarita  at the finish line
  • Margarita Madness™ Race Bib
  • Admission to Margarita Madness After Party

MADNESS SPECTATORS

  • $10 Pre-Sale Madness
  • 2 Margarita samples
  • Admission To After Party

*Madness Spectators not only add to the fun but also receive access to participate in a flight of 2 flavored Margaritas samples  at our after party and enjoy the energizing race party with music and entertainment.

assetDescriptions.description:
This year we'll be running at Kellogg Zaher Park which is located at Washington & Buffalo just off the Summerlin Parkway. 

Our Beneficiaries
This year CBRE - Las Vegas has chosen the After School All-Stars as beneficiary of the CBRE Cares Catch the Leprechaun Run 2017. 

Parking
There is more than ample parking in the parking lot at the center portion of Kellogg Zaher Park just off Washington at the Cimmaron entrance to the park. 

Packet Pick-up
Packet Pick-up will be on Friday, March 31, 2017, from 3:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m. at the corporate office of CBRE - Las Vegas in the Hughes Center.  The address is:

3993 Howard Hughes Parkway, Suite 700 (7th Floor)
Las Vegas, NV  89169
702.369.4800 (for directions)

Race Day Schedule
6:30 a.m. - late registration & packet pick-up
7:40 a.m. - warm-up & stretching
7:50 a.m. - race instructions and announcements
8:00 a.m. - 5K START
8:05 a.m. - 1-Mile START
9:30 a.m. - Awards Ceremony

assetDescriptions.description:
Limited time offer: Use code COLORMY5K for $30 off registration (any category)!

ColorMy5K color runs will exceed your expectations for fun!

www.ColorMy5K.com

100% of proceeds benefit scientific research on cancer and Alzheimer's disease.  Your participation in ColorMy5K makes a difference!

ColorMy5K is the best color-themed race that celebrates fitness, friends, and fun.  It’s a color party with a purpose!

Start in white and get ready for ColorMy5K!

All participants receive a free ColorMy5K t-shirt, race bib, finisher medal, temp tattoo, color pack, refreshments, and entrance to the post-race ColorMy5K Party (a celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!)

Four Reasons to Choose ColorMy5K:

  • FUN:  Twice the color, lowest prices, free t-shirt and finisher medal, music/dancing/color celebration!
  • LOCATION:  Nationwide in 2017!
  • CHARITY:  100% of proceeds donated to AD research.
  • COLOR:  A celebration of color!

 

What is the color made from?
The magical color powder we use is custom manufactured and produced in the United States.  It is made from food grade quality cornstarch and is 100% non-toxic and biodegradable.  As with any substance, you will want to keep it out of your eyes and lungs.  If you are overly sensitive, you may want to wear glasses or goggles for your eyes and use a bandana or dust mask for your mouth (this is especially recommended for our younger runners/walkers).

Is the race timed?
No, the race and its participants do not get timed.  Run, skip, or walk!  ColorMy5K is about having a good time for a great cause.

Will the color stain my clothes, shoes, or makeup?
If you want a lot of color to hit your free t-shirt, plan to run or walk closer to the color throwers.  If you want only a little bit of color, run or walk in the farthest lane from the throwers.  The color does wash out after the event.  As with any stain, the sooner you wash it the better.  We suggest wearing items that you wouldn't mind getting the color on.

Will the color get in my car?
Bring a towel or some plastic bags along, and you’ll be just fine.  However, if you do get some in your vehicle, it can be dusted away or vacuumed easily.

Event details and schedule

  • 1:00pm:  Runners arrive on site.  On-site check-in begins.
  • 2:30pm:  On-site check-in ends.  Runners, please be on-site and checked in by this time (30 minutes prior to the start of the race).
  • 2:50pm:  Runners start to line up.
  • 3:00pm:  The ColorMy5K race begins!
  • 4:00pm:  ColorMy5K Party!  A celebration of music, dancing, and massive color throws!

assetDescriptions.description:
The original trail race in Red Rock National Conservation Area…now in its fifth year. A half marathon, 10K, and 5K on the breathtaking trails of Red Rock NCA! You won’t find better views or more amazing scenery than that of Red Rock Canyon. This event is limited to 200 participants, so register early, as it is sure to sell out.
